rows.text: "Episode 275"
Jo Masters
Jo Johnson
Joe Fraser
5 January 2005

Friends of PC Powell kidnap him on his wedding day, determined to 'cure' him of his homosexuality. DC Perkins tries to prove his suspicions that brother Ben is a child abuser, while no-nonsense new DC Jo Masters arrives at Sun Hill to defuse the tension between DCI Meadows and DI Manson - but proves to be their worst nightmare.

"Episode 276"
Sylvie Boden
Andrew Taft
6 January 2005

DS De Costa and DC Sim join forces in a bid to find out whether Terry's brother Ben has been abusing his son, while PC Harman attempts to deal with an emergency at St Hugh's hospital, only to find herself staring down the barrel of a gun. Back at the station, DCI Meadows resolves to give DC Masters the benefit of the doubt - unlike DI Manson, who continues to seethe over her arrival.

"Episode 277"
Sylvie Boden
Damian Wayling
12 January 2005

The siege at the hospital takes a turn for the worse as DCI Meadows and DI Manson are taken hostage at gunpoint after an abortive attempt to free PC Valentine. DC Masters takes charge of the delicate negotiations, while PC Hunter realises only he can save PC Harman. Elsewhere, DS Nixon is appalled to learn Abi is carrying Hugh Wallis's baby, and DC Perkins begins to doubt whether his brother is guilty of the child abuse charges.

"Episode 278"
Colin Fairfax
Nigel Keen
Harold Jordan
13 January 2005

DS Nixon feels trapped in a never-ending nightmare when a confrontation with Abi leads to yet another revelation - she intends to marry her erstwhile kidnapper Hugh. Turning to DS Hunter for help, DS Nixon hatches a plan to snatch her pregnant, brainwashed daughter from the psychopath's clutches. Two community support officers, PCSOs Laura Bryant and Colin Fairfax, are assigned to Sun Hill, where they are greeted by a contemptuous outburst from Sgt. Smith.

"Episode 279"
Nigel Keen
Graham Mitchell
19 January 2005

Hugh turns the tables on DS Nixon by dropping in at Sun Hill and accusing her of abducting her own daughter. As the tug of love moves toward a dramatic conclusion, DS Nixon desperately tries to make Abi realise she has been brainwashed - and DCI Meadows isn't as supportive as he might be. Elsewhere, Scott Burnett's wife is found murdered, and PC Harman is assigned as his family liaison officer.

"Episode 280"
Robert Gwilym
Laurence Moody
Katherine Smith
20 January 2005

DC Sim and DC Masters investigate a case involving rent boys and pornography, leading DCI Meadows to organise a raid on the home of DAC Pearson, DI Manson's father-in-law. DS Nixon struggles to prove that Hugh abducted, brainwashed and raped her daughter, and despite strong evidence, he arrogantly sticks to his story that Abi instigated the sexual relationship that has left her pregnant and emotionally wrecked. PC Harman tells PC Hunter about her unprofessional behaviour with Scott Burnett.

"Episode 281"
Laurence Moody
Isabelle Grey
26 January 2005

PCs Murphy and Kappor investigate a man accused of deliberately infecting women with HIV, but PC Kapoor reckons her colleague is prejudiced against the colour of the suspect's skin - and when she learns that PC Murphy was demoted to PC because of a racism allegation, it seems her worst fears are confirmed. DC Carver is appalled when PCs Powell and Valentine discover the decomposing body of a vagrant, later identified as his ex-wife, Marie. DI Manson is forced to accept that his father-in-law has been using the services of rent boys.

"Episode 282"
Richard Standeven
Henrietta Hardy
27 January 2005

PCs Murphy and Kapoor investigate the suspicious death of a baby, but soon find themselves at odds when it seems accusations of abuse directed at the infant's asylum-seeker parents could be fuelled by racism. PCs Harman and Johannsen fight over PC Hunter's affections, leading to PC Harman accusing PC Johannsen of deliberately trying to ruin her relationship. However, she later displays breathtaking hypocrisy, by falling into bed with Scott Burnett, after he is accused of murdering his wife. DI Manson is upset after he catches PC Dunbar kissing Sgt. Smith, and confronts her about who she really wants.

"Episode 283"
Richard Standeven
Harold Jordan
2 February 2005

A Friday night shift proves a hectic time for the Sun Hill coppers as a childhood friend of PC Johannsen's is raped, DS Hunter and DC Best go undercover to trap and collar a drug dealer, and a mugging victim is attacked for a second time after being ignored by Acting Sgt. Hemmingway. PC Harman decides to break off her relationship by PC Hunter. DI Manson promises to leave his wife for PC Dubar, DS Hunter is forced to attend sex addiction classes by his wife, and Acting Sgt. Hemmingway learns she's no longer Acting Sergeant.

"Episode 284"
June Ackland
Sven Arnstein
Roy Boulter
3 February 2005

Jaws drop at Sun Hill as June Ackland returns to take up the post of sergeant, a mere two months after her retirement. It's no secret she needs the money to clear DC Carver's gambling debts − but she makes it plain she's not prepared to be a figure of fun or pity. Meanwhile, DC Best finds himself implicated in a money-laundering operation after falling for a woman's charms, PC Dunbar acts as a decoy to trap unlicensed cab drivers, and rejects propositions from DI Manson and Sgt. Smith, and DS Hunter continues to prove to his wife that he is not addicted to sex.

"Episode 285"
Sven Arnstein
Steve Griffiths
9 February 2005

Sgt. Ackland leaps to PC Valentine's defence after the leader of a gang of rowdy schoolgirls accuses him of indecent assault, and later plants a kiss on the startled copper - leaving an ominous question mark hanging over her already troubled relationship with Jim. DC Best swears revenge on the female con-artist who inveigled him into the money laundering racket, and in an attempt to bring her to justice, enlists the help of DC Masters. PC Dunbar is determined to remain undercover, and promises her editor a scoop on a blue-on-blue murder.

Episode 288
Russell Floyd
Nic Phillips
Simon Moss
23 February 2005

PC Dunbar's cover has been well and truly blown, leaving her to face the wrath of Insp. Gold and fatally compromising her testimony at the trial of rapist Alan Kennedy. Desperate to redeem herself, she makes one last effort to gather incriminating evidence against PC Kent - only to end up being held hostage in a storeroom by the crazed copper. Meanwhile, PCSO Fairfax is driven over the edge after being exposed as a racist, and in a bid to assert his authority, kidnaps DC Drummond and handcuffs him into the back of a delivery van, before driving it into the front office, and causing an explosion to rip through Sun Hill.

"Episode 289"
Natalie J. Robb
Nic Phillips
Mark Johnson
24 February 2005

An inferno sweeps through Sun Hill station in the aftermath of the explosion, giving PC Kent the chance to make good his escape, callously leaving PC Dunbar trapped under fallen debris as the flames creep closer. Sgt. Smith also faces a fiery demise in the burning building, while DC Carver struggles to accept the news that his friend DC Drummond was killed instantly when the van blew up. Supt. Okaro confirms the deaths of PC Dunbar and SRO Chambers, leaving PC Hollis and DI Manson to find comfort in each other as they reminisce about the time they spent with each of their loved ones. DC Carver suspects Sgt. Ackland is having an affair with PC Valentine, and Insp. Gold suspects that PC Kent's actions may not be as clear cut as they seem.

24 February 2005

With nothing but a bottle of scotch and a run-down sofa, DC Carver reminisces his twenty-two-year career at Sun Hill. He discusses the events of his first day, where he arrived late at work due to a dodgy alarm clock, his two different stints working in CID, his return to uniform, and his gambling debts which nearly cost him his life.

"Episode 290"
David Edwards
Christopher Reason
2 March 2005

In the aftermath of the disaster, PC Hollis is overwhelmed with grief at the loss of his soul mate, DI Manson bottles up his feelings, and PC Kent is hailed as a hero for rescuing Sgt. Smith. With MIT and the anti-terrorism squad crawling over the burnt-out shell of the Sun Hill station, PC Stamp investigates a link between PCSO Fairfax and a local extremist group. PCs Valentine and Johannsen are called out to facilitate a social worker's access to a young child, leading DS De Costa and DC Perkins get involved when they discover that the father has a conviction for sex with a minor. Sgt. Ackland struggles to adjust to life without DC Carver.

27 April 2005

Supt. Okaro reminisces about events of the past ten years of life at Sun Hill. Over a bottle of scotch, he recalls events including the two Sun Hill fires, which together claimed the lives of nine officers, the death of PC Kerry Young after being shot by the Sun Hill sniper, a fire at Sgt. June Ackland's flat in 1995, which was the result of a stalker who had been following her over the outcome of a case, and his own first day at Sun Hill, where he saved a young girl from the clutches of her father who had been abusing her.

DCI Meadows officially opens the newly rebuilt station, while Supt. Okaro's grief at the loss of his entire family in a fatal car crash is compounded by suggestions that his wife Denise drove through a red light while talking on her mobile phone. Margaret Barnes is taken to hospital, where a nurse realises that the blood on her clothes is not consistent with her wounds. DS De Costa realises DC Perkins has been stabbed and rushes home to find him bleeding to death. PC Powell and PCSO Bryant continue to help a delinquent's mother who has been beaten up by her son. They track Jordan Tomlin to a local pool hall, where they are taken aback to see Supt. Okaro apparently buying drugs from Adi Mateen. DS Nixon is impressed by DS Hunter's uncharacteristic chivalry while working on a case, and asks if he'd like to get together with her socially. Unfortunately, their date is ruined by the reappearance of a figure from his past.

Supt. Okaro attends the funeral of his wife, son and daughter, where he is comforted by Insp. Gold, who goes on to compound his distress by telling him that she has cancer. PC Powell and PCSO Bryant continue to try to help local delinquent Jordan Tomlin. PC Powell is concerned when he discovers Supt. DCI Morell investigates PC Harman's apparent abduction by new husband Scott Burnett, little suspecting she has fled with him of her own volition and is preparing to set sail for France. Unfortunately, he blurts out a confession of his guilt as they're waiting for the boat to arrive, leaving her facing the uncomfortable realisation that she's trapped with a murderer. Back at Sun Hill, PC Hemmingway leaves herself open to charges of using excessive force to detain a suspect and PC Johannsen teases PC Casper about his alleged run-in with a gang of armed youths.

PC Stamp is in hospital recovering from a savage beating, PC Hemmingway has been suspended over the death of a suspect and PCs Kent and Valentine are reprimanded for using CS spray. There is confusion in the relief about the use of reasonable force and Sgt. Ackland calls for strike action. DCI Meadows orders DC Nadir to remain deskbound following a death threat, but against orders, he sets up an operation with PC Powell, and they soon find themselves held at gunpoint. PSCO Bryant looks at PC Kent with new eyes when he takes a surprisingly compassionate approach to her wayward son Liam, who is being bullied because of her job. Supt. "Episode 326" "Responsibilities"
Elizabeth Bennett
13 July 2005

DS Hunter's mum Lynne turns up at the station to lecture him on his responsibilities as a father-to-be. Sgt. Smith seizes an opportunity to meet local villain's wife Louise Larson and continue their dangerous relationship, while Supt. Okaro struggles to make headway with his road safety campaign, until old friend Isaac Collins pulls a few strings at the local council to help get it under way. The case against DC Perkins's brother Ben concludes, but the outcome promises to have a devastating long-term effect on the entire family.

"Episode 327" "No Pocket Cop: Part 1"
14 July 2005

DC Best investigates when a pallet of stolen lamps are found being sold down the local market. He and DC Masters investigate, but a raid on the warehouse holding the stolen goods proves more than eventful when he is shot in the back by the leader of a drug smuggling ring. DS Hunter vows to catch the thug responsible for assaulting Kate Maltby, but his actions inadvertently result in a proposal of marriage. Insp. Gold returns to work after her cancer treatment, but she is clearly unfit for work. When she seeks solace in the arms of Jonathan Fox, he knocks her back with the revelation that he already has a girlfriend. Supt. Okaro hits another snag with his road safety initiative, but his old friend Isaac Collins soon comes to his rescue.

"Episode 328" "No Pocket Cop: Part 2"
Ciaran Griffiths
20 July 2005

DC Best survives the shooting, but discovers he may be paralysed from the waist down. When he receives the good news that he will make a full recovery, he reunites with his estranged mother, and decides to return to Manchester, where he can be close with his family. His last night in Sun Hill proves to be a good one, however - when he is joined for a midnight rendesvouz by PC Harman. DCI Meadows and CID begin the search for the gunman, Martie Kenton, but are soon led to the doorstep of Supt. Okaro's old friend, Isaac Collins. Sgt. Smith and Jonathan Fox investigate Insp. Gold's absence, and find her passed out in her bathroom. PC Stamp hires an escort to accompany him to PC Harman's birthday party, but she turns out to be none other than PC Johannsen.

"Episode 329" "Trust"
Ian Barratt
21 July 2005

Supt. Okaro tenders his resignation as photographs of him smoking a joint with Isaac Collins are passed on to the MET. However, unbeknown to the relief, he has gone undercover for the NCS, hoping to identify Collins for the rogue that he is. When Collins offers him the job of a security consultant, he uses it a pretext to begin his investigation. Meanwhile, Ch Supt Barratt arrives at Sun Hill to take control of the situation, and unknown to him, he comes dangerously close to discovering the affair between PC Casper and his wife, Rochelle. PC Johannsen exploits her new status as PC Stamp's 'girlfriend', so he decides to end their relationship. DCI Meadows challenges DI Manson over his relationship with DC Sim after he catches them in a compromising situation.

When Collins offers him the job of a security consultant, he uses it a pretext to begin his investigation. Meanwhile, Ch Supt Barratt arrives at Sun Hill to take control of the situation, and unknown to him, he comes dangerously close to discovering the affair between PC Casper and his wife, Rochelle. PC Johannsen exploits her new status as PC Stamp's 'girlfriend', so he decides to end their relationship. DCI Meadows challenges DI Manson over his relationship with DC Sim after he catches them in a compromising situation.

"Episode 330" "Closing Ranks"
27 July 2005

DCI Meadows' delight at being made into Acting Superintendent is short lived after a visit to his son Benjamin leads him to discover that he is using cocaine - and he has no choice but to arrest his own son. DS De Costa's celebration in light of being made into Acting DI is also cut short when DC Perkins gives her the cold shoulder after she expresses her digust at him having an affair with his sister-in-law behind his brother's back. PC Casper receives another poison pen letter, warning him to end his affair with Rochelle Barratt. The pair are convinced that the letters are nothing but a lame joke - but just who knows about their sordid affair? PCs Valentine and Casper investigate when a teacher is assaulted by a thirteen-year-old boy, Ross Trescot. Determined to get to the bottom of the case, the pair find themselves out of their depth when the boy accuses the teacher of assault.

"Episode 331" "To Catch A Killer: Part 1"
Hywel Bennett
28 July 2005

Acting Supt. Meadows questions his son Benjamin after his arrest for possession of cocaine. However, the case is soon compilicated when Benjamin's fingerprints match those from an unsolved assault case. Acting DI De Costa and DS Nixon invest investigate the disappearance of a young nurse, Manisha Devi, after an altercation in which she managed to defuse a fight between a prostitute and a punter. DS Nixon is alarmed when a CCTV image captures serial rapist Peter Baxter in the vicinity when the nurse disappeared. However, she is unable to convince herself that he has returned to his old ways. PC Hemmingway is delighted when she receives good news as the internal inquiry into the death of Lee Thomas is concluded.

"Episode 332" "To Catch A Killer: Part 2"
Hywel Bennett
3 August 2005

DCI Morrell arrives to help investigate when the burnt body of missing nurse Manisha Devi is found dumped inside the remains of a derilict cinema. DS Nixon arrests Peter Baxter on suspicion of her murder, but finds sufficient evidence to hold him. However, she soon realises that she may be able to use his knowledge to her advantage. Acting DI De Costa goes to speak to taxi driver David Russo, unaware that her colleagues back at the station have identified him as the new prime suspect in the murder.

"Episode 333" "To Catch A Killer: Part 3"
Hywel Bennett
4 August 2005

DS Nixon and DC Nadir manage to track down Acting DI De Costa before she can come to harm at the hands of suspect taxi driver David Russo. DCI Morell has no choice but to release Russo on bail when DNA tests fail to prove that he committed the murder of Manisha Devi. But a shocking revelation soon provides an answer as to why. DS Nixon uses former suspect Peter Baxter to help identify the location of missing consultant Rebecca Chapman. As part of a deal, she offers to speak to one of his former victims, Ruth Cohen. Sgt. Ackland arrives to investigate a routine arson incident, but soon finds herself being assaulted and raped at the hands of thirteen-year-old tearaway Ross Trescot.

DS Hunter finally admits to fiancé Kate Maltby that he is still married to Cindy. After she kicks him out, she seeks solace in the arms of his brother, PC Hunter. PC Murphy interviews Sgt. Ackland after the attack on her by Ross Trescot. "Episode 335"
11 August 2005

Roger and Dan find a missing schoolgirl in some woods. She has just given birth, but there is no sign of a baby. Phil recognises ex-informant Frank Mann, but Ho discovers that he is working on a drugs deal with a corrupt customs officer. Phil bids farewell to his daughter, Maddy, who is being taken to Australia by her mother. He makes up with fiancé Kate, unaware that she has slept with his brother Steve. Yvonne faces formal manslaughter charges following the inquest into the death of Lee Thomas. After a drink with friends from the relief she is racially abused by a drunk and assaults him.

Gina assists Dan and Reg in attending to an elderly man whose growing confusion makes him behave in an aggressive manner. He is later reported missing in possession of a loaded gun. Gina has snuck off to the pub and cannot be contacted. Prosser calls in SO19, but they storm the wrong house. Gina returns to duty and persuades the man to surrender his weapon. Barratt is furious and, looking for a scapegoat, Prosser tells him about Gina's absence and her drinking on duty. Gina is suspended from duty while her drink problem is assessed. Sam and Zain investigate a former associate of Pete Larson, and Zain goes undercover to buy a passport. Smithy is in bed with Mrs Larson when her husband returns home unexpectedly.

Paul Marquess
14 September 2005

Jo is assigned as contact officer for a notorious child killer, Lesley Palmer, now released after 20 years in prison. Unfortunately, Palmer has told a former cell mate about her new identity. Police investigating an assault at a clip joint cannot get a witness to talk. Roger recognises Anka and persuades her to give a statement, but she is sacked for her trouble. Roger offers to let her stay at his house. She later offers herself to him and, when he rejects her, she decides to move out. Sheelagh deals with an assault victim who refuses to make a statement. Laura tells Sheelagh that the woman and Gabriel were lovers. Sheelagh confronts Gabriel, who proposes to her.

Johnathan Young

Roger agrees to investigate an assault on the boyfriend and business partner of his estranged wife Sandra, who seeks a divorce. "Episode 348"
21 September 2005

Reg has organised an event to celebrate 50 years of Sun Hill police station. Former DCS Charles Barnet, who is to be a guest speaker, is keen to be taken out on patrol, and Tony and Dan take him out in the area car. The PCs are embarrassed by the old-fashioned attitudes of the former detective, who puts his back out while helping them with an arrest. Roger and Yvonne investigate a road traffic accident in which an eight-year-old boy has been killed by a joy-rider. Witnesses confirm that the boy had run in front of the car. Prosser tells the father, Jeff Clarke, that the driver will only be charged with minor offences, and he takes the news badly. Laura is surprised when a man calling himself Gabriel Kent calls in at the station and asks to see June. She mentions this to Gabriel, who dismisses the visitor as a local nutter. Gabriel goes to see his adopted brother, who quickly realises that David has stolen his identity. Meanwhile, Jeff Clarke turns up at the station and demands that his son's killer be prosecuted.

Episode 349
Amanda Prosser
22 September 2005

Several of the station's staff are taken hostage in the CID office by Jeff Clarke, who has a mental breakdown and fails to realise what he is doing. During the hostage situation, he accidentally shoots Dan, and Meadows brings in SO19 to bring him down. However, they accidentally shoot the real Gabriel Kent, who at the time, is confronting his brother. Prosser designs to hand back over control of the station to Okaro after the night's events.

"Episode 351"
Julie Legrand
29 September 2005

June identifies the comatose man in St Hugh's as her son, Gabriel Kent, and tells Smithy and Laura that the fake Gabriel is his adoptive brother, David, who stole his identity. Smithy persuades June not to tell Okaro, as she would be in trouble for keeping his secret. Sam and Jo track Lesley Palmer to Oxfordshire, where she has lured her ex-partner. She threatens to kill him unless he reveals the whereabouts of the body of the child that he killed 20 years before. Phil and Terry investigate a sudden death. They stumble across a low-rent pimp and gather evidence to convict him.

"Episode 352"
5 October 2005

Terry assists Ramani in an investigation into a serious assault on his sister-in-law, Lucy. A camera found at the scene leads to the uncovering of an extortion scam run by a convicted paedophile who is threatening to harm the families of other prisoners. Sam and Zain investigate the theft of a lorry-load of designer sunglasses. Phil identifies the likely culprit, and investigations lead a woman who is selling stolen goods from a beauty salon. Cindy Hunter is furious when her salon is raided and blames her husband. Gabriel is feeling the pressure and tries to persuade fiancé Sheelagh to leave Sun Hill. Laura tells a disbelieving Sheelagh the truth about David and his brother, Gabriel.

"Episode 353"
Todd Carty
6 October 2005

Gabriel arrives home to find fiancé Sheelagh going through his belongings. He tries to put a positive spin on his deception but she is unconvinced and he ties her up. Laura and Tony track her down and bring her to safety. Smithy prompts Sam to establish the identity of the victim of the Sun Hill siege. June decides to pair with Gabriel, but when they are called to St Hugh's, Gabriel switches off his brother's life support and smothers him. Called to deal with a disturbance in a tower block, Gabriel drags June to the roof and threatens to kill her. Sam and Smithy lead a group of officers to their location. Smithy and Gabriel fight as June looks on.
